item.title: Finding The 100 Megabit Connection
item.description:
The increasing need for high-bandwidth applications like video streaming, medical image transfer, and cloud computing has made fractional Gigabit connections more prevalent. One such popular service is the 100 Mbps connection. Let’s explore the options for delivering this bandwidth. OC-3, a legacy fiber optic service using SONET (Synchronous Optical NETwork), offers 155 Mbps bandwidth. While higher than 100 Mbps, it’s a significant jump from the lower tier DS3 service at 45 Mbps...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/finding-the-100-megabit-connection/

item.title: Fiber Optic vs Copper 50 Mbps
item.description:
Businesses that need to connect numerous employees to the internet or move large files, particularly high-resolution images, require more bandwidth than a standard connection provides. Traditionally, they’ve upgraded their T1 lines to DS3 service, which offers 45 Mbps. Now, there are more choices for around 50 Mbps using both copper and fiber optic connections. DS3 is often considered a copper wireline service because it connects with coaxial cables and uses BNC connectors...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fiber-optic-vs-copper-50-mbps/
